Comment: Equinor is thinking about suing. Norway owns 67% of the shares of Equinor. St√∏re and Stoltenberg, the prime minister and minister of finance, are meeting Trump Thursday.  Smells a little of the fart of the deal Trump style - setting up a difficulty to get leverage, saying you gave a lot when you just didnt take away. But Norway was one of the few that simply shrugged and said "fine" to tariffs, that were ok with buying U.S. goods for billions. We were the most easy going of "partners" - at least until this. The warships are currently off the table, we might just be buying European instead.  I'm wondering if the ministers will bring it up, or simply focus on global stability.
